channel.title: Feature Selection on Austin David Brown

item.title: PCA in Python
item.description: Principal Components Analysis is an unsupervised learning or lossy compression method. Let $X = (X_i)_{i =1}^n$ such that $X_i \in \mathbb{R}^p$ be the data where $n$ is the number of observations and $p$ is the number of features. The sample covariance matrix with respect to the features is \[ \frac{1}{n} (X - \bar X)^T (X - \bar X) \] where the mean is with respect to the rows. This gives us all of the variance of covariance information of the features.
